FuncDef:
The mpls te leaf-list command creates a leaf list for a P2MP TE tunnel.
The undo mpls te leaf-list command deletes the leaf list configured for the P2MP TE tunnel.
By default, no leaf list is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a name for the leaf list. The name must be unique globally.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A leaf list is a collection of all leaf nodes created on a P2MP TE tunnel. A P2MP TE tunnel may include a large number of leaf nodes. Using a leaf list simplifies the configuration of a P2MP TE tunnel and helps create leaf nodes. A leaf list can be used by multiple P2MP TE tunnels.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the destination command to configure addresses of and explicit paths to the leaf nodes in the leaf list.Run the mpls te leaf-list (tunnel interface view) command to configure a leaf list and then establish P2MP TE tunnels.

Precautions
Before configuring the undo mpls te leaf-list command, you must configure the undo mpls te leaf-list command to delete the binding of the leaf list to the P2MP TE tunnel.
